## Descripción
What happens if you have a small exponent? There is a twist though, we padded the plaintext so that (M ** e) is just barely larger than N. Let's decrypt this: [ciphertext](https://mercury.picoctf.net/static/81689952b7442c3e23a9f703198c0a4c/ciphertext)


## Hints
+ RSA [tutorial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem))
+ How could having too small of an `e` affect the security of this key?
+ Make sure you don't lose precision, the numbers are pretty big (besides the `e` value)
+ You shouldn't have to make _too_ many guesses
+ `pico` is in the flag, but not at the beginning

## Solución
RSA 
``` bash
>>> from gmpy2 import *
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> gmpy2.get_context().precision=2048
>>> e=3
>>> c= 
>>> root, exact=iroot(c,e)
>>> root
mpz()
>>> print(long_to_bytes(root))
b"\x01\xeb\xabE\xfa \x8b^\x93Z\xb1BQL^\xd2j:\xdf\xa2\xd7\x8asK\x1d\xe5\xbfV\x0e\xcd\x1e!d2\x1fj\x9c\xed\x9d\xd6n\x96\x07\xc0,\xd0O'\xc7\xc1+Z^\xbfln9\x80\xcd\x11\x99\x96(\xf7\xd1\x8b\xcb\xbf'\xd5\xf3\xc3\x1b\x9a!\xbb\x9d\xb4\x7f\xdb\xde\xcfU\x0f\xee\xfd#Hl6d\xe0\xe3Y\xc9,\x8bh\xd3\x8eZW\xbeQ\x90\xf9%o\xa5\x16\x80\xbdy\xd16X6\xf0\xce\x1e\xfa\xcf\xedN\xde*\xde\\_\nw;\xa7\xfe\x808\xad7\xa1 "
>>> 

```


## Flag
``` picoCTF{} ```
